title: Foundation Number Practice Test
description: Test your counting and comparing skills with these fun questions!

questions.question: How many fingers are on one hand?
questions.explanation: One hand has 5 fingers. You can count them: thumb (1), pointer (2), middle (3), ring (4), pinky (5).

questions.question: What number comes after 7?
questions.explanation: When we count forward, the number after 7 is 8. The sequence goes: 6, 7, 8, 9, 10.

questions.question: Which group has MORE objects? Group A has 3 stars. Group B has 6 stars.
questions.explanation: Group B has 6 stars and Group A has 3 stars. Since 6 is greater than 3, Group B has more objects.

questions.question: Count the objects: ball, ball, ball, ball. How many balls are there?
questions.explanation: Count each ball: 1, 2, 3, 4. There are 4 balls. The last number you say is the total.

questions.question: Which number is the smallest?
questions.explanation: When we compare 9, 2, 5, and 7, the smallest number is 2. It comes first when we count: 2, 5, 7, 9.

questions.question: There are 4 red blocks and 4 blue blocks. Which statement is correct?
questions.explanation: Both groups have 4 blocks. When two groups have the same number, we say they are equal. 4 = 4.

questions.question: What number comes after 9 when counting forward?
questions.explanation: When counting forward from 9, the next number is 10. The sequence goes: 8, 9, 10.

questions.question: How many eyes do you have?
questions.explanation: You have 2 eyes â€” one on the left and one on the right.

questions.question: Count: 1, 2, 3, ___, 5. What number is missing?
questions.explanation: The missing number is 4. When counting forward: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. Each number is one more than the number before.

questions.question: Sam has 5 apples and Mia has 8 apples. Who has fewer apples?
questions.explanation: Sam has 5 apples and Mia has 8 apples. Since 5 is less than 8, Sam has fewer apples.
